article_headline: A little knowledge is a useless thing
article_text: LOS ANGELES (AP) â€” At least 58 near collisions of airplanes have occurred over Southern California so far this year, and in at least two dozen instances, the aircraft missed one another by less than 500 feet, it was reported today. Statewide, 86 near collisions were reported through May 10 compared to 56 for the period in 1986, according to the records. There were 204 near collisions reported in California for all of last year. In at least 11 instances, air traffic controllers did not see the impending collisions on their radar scopes, according to Federal Aviation Administration reports.
